Sorry to hear that. You should eat hot and spicy food.
Stay hydrated, rest in a dark room, and take over-the-counter pain relievers.
Stay hydrated, try honey in warm water, and avoid irritants like smoke. If coughing persists beyond a week, see a doctor.
Rest, hydrate, and take acetaminophen. Seek help if fever exceeds 103°F (39.4°C) or lasts over 3 days.
Gargle with warm salt water, drink fluids, and rest. If severe or lasts >48 hours, consult a doctor.
Sip ginger tea or clear fluids. Avoid heavy meals. If accompanied by vomiting/dizziness, seek medical care.
Drink electrolytes, eat bland foods (e.g., bananas, rice), and avoid dairy. Consult a doctor if severe or bloody.
Apply ice/heat, avoid heavy lifting, and try gentle stretches. If pain radiates to legs or causes numbness, see a doctor.
Apply aloe vera, stay hydrated, and avoid sun exposure. Use OTC pain relievers if needed. Seek help for blisters/fever.
Limit screen time before bed, maintain a sleep schedule, and try relaxation techniques. Consult a doctor if chronic.
Take antihistamines, avoid allergens, and use a saline nasal rinse. Seek help for breathing difficulties.
Avoid spicy/fatty foods, eat smaller meals, and try antacids. If frequent, consult a doctor to rule out GERD.
Rest, apply ice/heat, and gently stretch. Consider OTC pain relievers. If severe/swelling occurs, seek medical advice.
Sit/lie down immediately, hydrate, and avoid sudden movements. If accompanied by chest pain/confusion, seek urgent care.
Rinse with warm salt water, use floss to remove debris, and see a dentist promptly. Avoid sugary foods.
Apply hydrocortisone cream and avoid scratching. If rash spreads or you develop a fever, consult a doctor.
Ensure adequate sleep, hydrate, and check for nutrient deficiencies (e.g., iron, B12). Rule out chronic conditions with a doctor.
